Hi guys, faith here. Originally I didn’t plan to break the 4th wall like this, but I’m feeling compelled to recently. Since this branch of the story has evolved into what amounts to a 6th season of sailor moon (albeit a very adult and, I hope, sexy season), I’d thought I’d share a few things about the assumptions I’ve been making for this story. Most of these you’ve probably picked up on, but I thought I might as well come out and say it definitively.

This story takes place an undefined amount of time after Sailor Moon Stars, but likely four or five years. I say ‘undefined’ because my research has yet to pin down an exact age for our characters at the climax of that series. To make matters worse, I’m an American trying to depict characters in a Japanese society I only know about via research and anime. So, for instance, I’m not sure how old a normal Japanese student would be when they first enter high school (an important point, given that the Inner Scouts are established as being high school freshmen at the end of the series). In any event, if your inclined to be a continuity hound (and don’t get me wrong, I try to be one myself) just realize I’m playing a little fast and loose with everyone’s age in the following description.

The girl got through the rest of high school in relative peace. Not to say that it was completely uneventful- all the girls except Usagi have gone on dates and had relationships like any normal student. But until the events of this story, there have been no significant battles or otherworldly threats attacking the earth. The girls have held weekly gatherings to confer with one another (using Rei’s temple or Haruka’s flat as their base of operations) and stage mock battles to keep in shape, but no one has developed any new attacks or transformations since Galaxia. As Usagi mentions, the act of resurrecting the dead Senshi at the end of her fight with Galaxia has caused her to lose her ability to assume her Eternal form at will. In theory, she can still assume that transformation if all the other scouts concentrated their power on her, but so far no such threat has arisen.

The inner scouts decided after high school to attend the same university. This was easier for some than others. Usagi and Minako especially had a hard time on the entrance exams for everyone’s preferred university (who’s name I’ll make up when it becomes necessary). But after a few years of struggling, all the girls were finally enrolled. Their choice of university was partially dictated by their outer counterparts- all the girls agreed they wanted to attend the same school Haruka and Michiru had gotten into. As circumstances would have it, the two outer scouts are now seniors at this university in the same semester as our inner scouts are attending as freshmen. Overseas, Mamoru has been attending Harvard for many years, earning first a bachelors then a Doctorate in his studies. This will be his final semester in America. Hotaru was attending middle school, but that arrangement has hit some BIG complications recently. Chibiusa hasn’t been seen since she left for the future in Sailor Moon Stars, but Pluto assures everyone that she and their future counterparts are doing well.

Currently, Usagi and the inner scouts are all 21 years old. (I know I had haruka comment early on in the story that Usagi was 18….feel free to ignore that or assume it was some private joke between her and Michiru- the story will just work better if usagi is a little bit older than that). Haruka and Michiru are 24 years old at this point. Tuxedo Mask is a bit older than that, we’ll say 25 (little ambigious there). Pluto physically is the oldest scout, looking somewhere around 27 years old. This point is somewhat moot in her case, since her actual age is at least several thousand years older than everyone else and could potentially number in the millions. If we can take the appearance of the scouts in Chibiusa’s timeline as any indication, aging pretty much stops for the senshi somewhere in the mid-20s.

Hotaru is obviously an interesting case. Physically she’s hopped around the age bracket throughout the series. She’s supposed to be 11 or 12 when we first meet her. Mistress 9 turns her into an adult, which to my eyes was older than any of the scouts. Then when she’s reborn she’s only one year old. In the 5th season her biological age jumps to about 5 years old, then jumps AGAIN to an age comparable to where she was when we first met her. Since we aren’t told exactly how old she is when the 5th season closes, I’m assuming she was 14 when this story opens (same age as Usagi when she became sailor moon for the first time). Kind of a moot point now that her powers bumped her age up once again to roughly 20 years old, but there it is anyway.

Chibiusa we’ll cover when (not if) we get to her.

And that’s pretty much everything. Oh, and if your wondering what to call this “season”, my suggestion would be to follow the usual traditions for Sailor Moon. Since past seasons used letters to differentiate each other (Sailor Moon R, Sailor Moon S, Sailor Moon Super S), just think of this as Sailor Moon ENF.
